proteusPy.DisulfideVisualization

This module provides visualization functionality for disulfide bonds in the proteusPy package.

Author: Eric G. Suchanek, PhD Last revision: 2025-02-12

  57class DisulfideVisualization:
  58    """Provides visualization methods for Disulfide bonds, including 3D rendering,
  59    statistical plots, and overlay displays."""
  60
  61    @staticmethod
  62    def enumerate_class_fromlist(tclass: DisulfideClassManager, sslist, base=8):
  63        """Enumerate the classes from a list of class IDs.
  64
  65        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
  66        :param sslist: List of class IDs to enumerate
  67        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
  68        :return: DataFrame with class IDs and counts
  69        """
  70        x = []
  71        y = []
  72
  73        for cls in sslist:
  74            if cls is not None:
  75                _y = tclass.sslist_from_classid(cls, base=base)
  76                # it's possible to have 0 SS in a class
  77                if _y is not None:
  78                    # only append if we have both.
  79                    x.append(cls)
  80                    y.append(len(_y))
  81
  82        sslist_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=["class_id", "count"])
  83        sslist_df["class_id"] = x
  84        sslist_df["count"] = y
  85        return sslist_df
  86
  87    @staticmethod
  88    def plot_classes_vs_cutoff(
  89        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
  90        cutoff: float,
  91        steps: int = 50,
  92        base=8,
  93        theme="auto",
  94        verbose=False,
  95    ) -> None:
  96        """Plot the total percentage and number of members for each octant class against the cutoff value.
  97
  98        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
  99        :param cutoff: Percent cutoff value for filtering the classes
 100        :param steps: Number of steps to take in the cutoff
 101        :param base: The base class to use, 6 or 8
 102        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot ('auto', 'light', or 'dark')
 103        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 104        :return: None
 105        """
 106        _cutoff = np.linspace(0, cutoff, steps)
 107        tot_list = []
 108        members_list = []
 109        base_str = "Octant" if base == 8 else "Binary"
 110
 111        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 112
 113        for c in _cutoff:
 114            class_df = tclass.filter_class_by_percentage(c, base=base)
 115            tot = class_df["percentage"].sum()
 116            tot_list.append(tot)
 117            members_list.append(class_df.shape[0])
 118            if verbose:
 119                print(
 120                    f"Cutoff: {c:5.3} accounts for {tot:7.2f}% and is {class_df.shape[0]:5} members long."
 121                )
 122
 123        fig = go.Figure()
 124
 125        # Add total percentage trace
 126        fig.add_trace(
 127            go.Scatter(
 128                x=_cutoff,
 129                y=tot_list,
 130                mode="lines+markers",
 131                name="Total percentage",
 132                yaxis="y1",
 133                line=dict(color="blue"),
 134            )
 135        )
 136
 137        # Add number of members trace
 138        fig.add_trace(
 139            go.Scatter(
 140                x=_cutoff,
 141                y=members_list,
 142                mode="lines+markers",
 143                name="Number of members",
 144                yaxis="y2",
 145                line=dict(color="red"),
 146            )
 147        )
 148
 149        # Update layout
 150        fig.update_layout(
 151            title={
 152                "text": f"{base_str} Classes vs Cutoff, ({cutoff}%)",
 153                "x": 0.5,
 154                "yanchor": "top",
 155                "xanchor": "center",
 156            },
 157            xaxis=dict(title="Cutoff"),
 158            yaxis=dict(
 159                title="Total percentage",
 160                titlefont=dict(color="blue"),
 161                tickfont=dict(color="blue"),
 162            ),
 163            yaxis2=dict(
 164                title="Number of members",
 165                titlefont=dict(color="red"),
 166                tickfont=dict(color="red"),
 167                overlaying="y",
 168                side="right",
 169                type="log",
 170            ),
 171            legend=dict(x=0.75, y=1.16),
 172        )
 173
 174        fig.show()
 175
 176    @staticmethod
 177    def plot_binary_to_eightclass_incidence(
 178        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
 179        theme="light",
 180        save=False,
 181        savedir=".",
 182        verbose=False,
 183    ):
 184        """Plot the incidence of all octant Disulfide classes for a given binary class.
 185
 186        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 187        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 188        :param save: Whether to save the plots
 189        :param savedir: Directory to save plots to
 190        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 191        """
 192        if verbose:
 193            _logger.setLevel("INFO")
 194
 195        clslist = tclass.binaryclass_df["class_id"]
 196        for cls in clslist:
 197            eightcls = tclass.binary_to_class(cls, 8)
 198            df = DisulfideVisualization.enumerate_class_fromlist(
 199                tclass, eightcls, base=8
 200            )
 201            DisulfideVisualization.plot_count_vs_class_df(
 202                df,
 203                title=cls,
 204                theme=theme,
 205                save=save,
 206                savedir=savedir,
 207                base=8,
 208                verbose=verbose,
 209            )
 210        if verbose:
 211            _logger.info("Graph generation complete.")
 212            _logger.setLevel("WARNING")
 213
 214    @staticmethod
 215    def plot_count_vs_class_df(
 216        df,
 217        title="title",
 218        theme="auto",
 219        save=False,
 220        savedir=".",
 221        base=8,
 222        verbose=False,
 223        log=True,
 224    ):
 225        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly for the given disulfide class.
 226
 227        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
 228        :param title: Title for the plot
 229        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 230        :param save: Whether to save the plot
 231        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
 232        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 233        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 234        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 235        """
 236        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 237
 238        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
 239        _labels = {}
 240        _prefix = "None"
 241        if base == 8:
 242            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 243            _prefix = "Octant"
 244        elif base == 2:
 245            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 246            _prefix = "Binary"
 247        else:
 248            raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8.")
 249
 250        fig = px.line(
 251            df,
 252            x="class_id",
 253            y="count",
 254            title=f"{_title}",
 255            labels=_labels,
 256        )
 257
 258        fig.update_layout(
 259            showlegend=True,
 260            title_x=0.5,
 261            title_font=dict(size=20),
 262            xaxis_showgrid=False,
 263            yaxis_showgrid=False,
 264            autosize=True,
 265            yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 266        )
 267        fig.update_layout(autosize=True)
 268
 269        if save:
 270            fname = Path(savedir) / f"{title}_{_prefix}.png"
 271
 272            if verbose:
 273                _logger.info("Saving %s plot to %s", title, fname)
 274            fig.write_image(fname, "png")
 275        else:
 276            fig.show()
 277
 278    @staticmethod
 279    def plot_count_vs_class_df_sampled(
 280        df,
 281        title="title",
 282        theme="auto",
 283        save=False,
 284        savedir=".",
 285        base=8,
 286        verbose=False,
 287        log=True,
 288        sample_size=1000,
 289    ):
 290        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly with sampling.
 291
 292        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
 293        :param title: Title for the plot
 294        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 295        :param save: Whether to save the plot
 296        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
 297        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 298        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 299        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 300        :param sample_size: Number of items to sample
 301        """
 302        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 303
 304        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
 305        _labels = {}
 306        _prefix = "None"
 307        if base == 8:
 308            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 309            _prefix = "Octant"
 310        elif base == 2:
 311            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 312            _prefix = "Binary"
 313        else:
 314            raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8.")
 315
 316        df_sampled = df.sample(n=sample_size)
 317
 318        fig = px.line(
 319            df_sampled,
 320            x="class_id",
 321            y="count",
 322            title=f"{_title} (Sampled {sample_size} items)",
 323            labels=_labels,
 324        )
 325
 326        fig.update_layout(
 327            showlegend=True,
 328            title_x=0.5,
 329            title_font=dict(size=20),
 330            xaxis_showgrid=False,
 331            yaxis_showgrid=False,
 332            autosize=True,
 333            yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 334        )
 335        fig.update_layout(autosize=True)
 336
 337        if save:
 338            fname = Path(savedir) / f"{title}_{_prefix}_sampled.png"
 339
 340            if verbose:
 341                _logger.info("Saving %s plot to %s", title, fname)
 342            fig.write_image(fname, "png")
 343        else:
 344            fig.show()

 346    @staticmethod
 347    def plot_count_vs_class_df_paginated(
 348        df,
 349        title="title",
 350        theme="auto",
 351        save=False,
 352        savedir=".",
 353        base=8,
 354        verbose=False,
 355        log=True,
 356        page_size=200,
 357    ):
 358        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly with pagination.
 359
 360        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
 361        :param title: Title for the plot
 362        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 363        :param save: Whether to save the plot
 364        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
 365        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 366        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 367        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 368        :param page_size: Number of items per page
 369        """
 370        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 371
 372        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
 373        _labels = {}
 374        _prefix = "None"
 375        if base == 8:
 376            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 377            _prefix = "Octant"
 378        elif base == 2:
 379            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 380            _prefix = "Binary"
 381        else:
 382            raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8.")
 383
 384        total_pages = (len(df) + page_size - 1) // page_size
 385
 386        for page in range(total_pages):
 387            start = page * page_size
 388            end = start + page_size
 389            df_page = df.iloc[start:end]
 390
 391            fig = px.line(
 392                df_page,
 393                x="class_id",
 394                y="count",
 395                title=f"{_title} (Page {page + 1}/{total_pages})",
 396                labels=_labels,
 397            )
 398
 399            fig.update_layout(
 400                showlegend=True,
 401                title_x=0.5,
 402                title_font=dict(size=20),
 403                xaxis_showgrid=False,
 404                yaxis_showgrid=False,
 405                autosize=True,
 406                yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 407            )
 408            fig.update_layout(autosize=True)
 409
 410            if save:
 411                fname = Path(savedir) / f"{title}_{_prefix}_page_{page + 1}.png"
 412
 413                if verbose:
 414                    _logger.info("Saving %s plot to %s", title, fname)
 415                fig.write_image(fname, "png")
 416            else:
 417                fig.show()
 418
 419    @staticmethod
 420    def plot_count_vs_classid(
 421        tclass: DisulfideClassManager, cls=None, theme="auto", base=8, log=True
 422    ):
 423        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly.
 424
 425        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 426        :param cls: Specific class to plot (optional)
 427        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 428        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 429        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 430        """
 431        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 432
 433        _title = None
 434
 435        match base:
 436            case 8:
 437                _title = "Octant Class Distribution"
 438            case 2:
 439                _title = "Binary Class Distribution"
 440            case _:
 441                raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8")
 442
 443        df = tclass.binaryclass_df if base == 2 else tclass.eightclass_df
 444
 445        if cls is None:
 446            fig = px.line(df, x="class_id", y="count", title=_title)
 447        else:
 448            subset = df[df["class_id"] == cls]
 449            fig = px.line(subset, x="class_id", y="count", title=_title)
 450
 451        fig.update_layout(
 452            xaxis_title="Class ID",
 453            yaxis_title="Count",
 454            showlegend=True,
 455            title_x=0.5,
 456            autosize=True,
 457            yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 458        )
 459
 460        fig.show()
 461
 462    @staticmethod
 463    def plot_disulfides_vs_pdbid(ssdict, cutoff=1):
 464        """Plot the number of disulfides versus PDB ID.
 465
 466        :param ssdict: Dictionary mapping PDB IDs to disulfide indices
 467        :param cutoff: Minimum number of disulfides required for inclusion
 468        :return: Tuple of (pdb_ids, num_disulfides)
 469        """
 470        pdbids = []
 471        num_disulfides = []
 472
 473        for pdbid, disulfides in ssdict.items():
 474            if len(disulfides) > cutoff:
 475                pdbids.append(pdbid)
 476                num_disulfides.append(len(disulfides))
 477
 478        # Create a DataFrame
 479        df = pd.DataFrame({"PDB ID": pdbids, "Number of Disulfides": num_disulfides})
 480        fig = px.bar(
 481            df,
 482            x="PDB ID",
 483            y="Number of Disulfides",
 484            title=f"Disulfides vs PDB ID with cutoff: {cutoff}, {len(pdbids)} PDB IDs",
 485        )
 486        fig.update_layout(
 487            xaxis_title="PDB ID",
 488            yaxis_title="Number of Disulfides",
 489            xaxis_tickangle=-90,
 490        )
 491        fig.show()
 492
 493        return pdbids, num_disulfides
 494
 495    @staticmethod
 496    def plot_classes(
 497        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
 498        class_string,
 499        base=8,
 500        theme="auto",
 501        log=False,
 502        page_size=200,
 503    ):
 504        """Plot the distribution of classes for the given class string.
 505
 506        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 507        :param class_string: The class string to plot
 508        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 509        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 510        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 511        :param page_size: Number of items per page
 512        """
 513        classlist = tclass.binary_to_class(class_string, base)
 514        df = DisulfideVisualization.enumerate_class_fromlist(
 515            tclass, classlist, base=base
 516        )
 517        DisulfideVisualization.plot_count_vs_class_df_paginated(
 518            df, title=class_string, theme=theme, base=base, log=log, page_size=page_size
 519        )
 520
 521    @staticmethod
 522    def display_sslist(sslist, style="sb", light="auto", panelsize=512):
 523        """Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
 524
 525        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 526        :param style: Rendering style: One of:
 527            - 'sb' - split bonds
 528            - 'bs' - ball and stick
 529            - 'cpk' - CPK style
 530            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
 531            - 'plain' - boring single color
 532        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
 533        :param panelsize: Size of each panel in pixels
 534        """
 535        ssbonds = sslist
 536        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number of ssbonds
 537        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 538        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
 539
 540        set_pyvista_theme(light)
 541
 542        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
 543        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_sslist(
 544            pl, sslist, style, panelsize=panelsize
 545        )
 546        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 547
 548        pl.link_views()
 549        pl.reset_camera()
 550        pl.show()
 551
 552    @staticmethod
 553    def display_overlay(
 554        sslist,
 555        screenshot=False,
 556        movie=False,
 557        verbose=False,
 558        fname="ss_overlay.png",
 559        light="auto",
 560        winsize=WINSIZE,
 561    ):
 562        """Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
 563        a common coordinate frame.
 564
 565        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 566        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot
 567        :param movie: Save a movie
 568        :param verbose: Verbosity
 569        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot
 570        :param light: Background color
 571        :param winsize: Window size tuple (width, height)
 572        """
 573        pid = sslist.pdb_id
 574        ssbonds = sslist
 575        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)
 576        avg_enrg = sslist.average_energy
 577        avg_dist = sslist.average_distance
 578        resolution = sslist.average_resolution
 579
 580        res = 64
 581        if tot_ss > 30:
 582            res = 48
 583        if tot_ss > 60:
 584            res = 16
 585        if tot_ss > 90:
 586            res = 8
 587
 588        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 589        fontsize = calculate_fontsize(title, winsize[0])
 590
 591        set_pyvista_theme(light)
 592
 593        if movie:
 594            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=True)
 595        else:
 596            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=False)
 597
 598        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
 599        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 600        pl.add_axes()
 601
 602        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
 603
 604        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
 605        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
 606        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
 607        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
 608
 609        if verbose:
 610            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
 611        else:
 612            pbar = range(tot_ss)
 613
 614        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
 615            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
 616            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
 617                ss,
 618                pl,
 619                style="plain",
 620                bondcolor=color,
 621                translate=False,
 622                bond_radius=brad,
 623                res=res,
 624            )
 625
 626        pl.reset_camera()
 627
 628        if screenshot:
 629            pl.show(auto_close=False)
 630            try:
 631                pl.screenshot(fname)
 632                if verbose:
 633                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
 634            except RuntimeError as e:
 635                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
 636
 637        elif movie:
 638            if verbose:
 639                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 640
 641            pl.open_movie(fname)
 642            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
 643            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
 644            pl.close()
 645
 646            if verbose:
 647                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 648        else:
 649            pl.show()
 650
 651    @staticmethod
 652    def display_torsion_statistics(
 653        sslist,
 654        display=True,
 655        save=False,
 656        fname="ss_torsions.png",
 657        theme="auto",
 658    ):
 659        """Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
 660
 661        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 662        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook
 663        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file
 664        :param fname: The name of the image file to save
 665        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 666        """
 667        if len(sslist) == 0:
 668            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
 669            return
 670
 671        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 672        title = f"{sslist.pdb_id}: {len(sslist)} members"
 673
 674        tor_vals, dist_vals = sslist.calculate_torsion_statistics()
 675
 676        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
 677        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]
 678
 679        dist_mean_vals = dist_vals.loc["mean"]
 680        dist_std_vals = dist_vals.loc["std"]
 681
 682        fig = make_subplots(
 683            rows=2, cols=2, vertical_spacing=0.125, column_widths=[1, 1]
 684        )
 685
 686        fig.update_layout(
 687            title={
 688                "text": title,
 689                "xanchor": "center",
 690                "x": 0.5,
 691                "yanchor": "top",
 692            },
 693            width=1024,
 694            height=1024,
 695        )
 696
 697        fig.add_trace(
 698            go.Bar(
 699                x=["X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5"],
 700                y=tor_mean_vals[:5],
 701                name="Torsion Angle (°) ",
 702                error_y=dict(type="data", array=tor_std_vals, visible=True),
 703            ),
 704            row=1,
 705            col=1,
 706        )
 707
 708        fig.add_trace(
 709            go.Bar(
 710                x=["rho"],
 711                y=[dist_mean_vals[4]],
 712                name="ρ (°)",
 713                error_y=dict(type="data", array=[dist_std_vals[4]], visible=True),
 714            ),
 715            row=1,
 716            col=1,
 717        )
 718
 719        fig.update_yaxes(
 720            title_text="Dihedral Angle (°)", range=[-200, 200], row=1, col=1
 721        )
 722        fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, 320], row=2, col=2)
 723
 724        fig.add_trace(
 725            go.Bar(
 726                x=["Strain Energy (kcal/mol)"],
 727                y=[dist_mean_vals[3]],
 728                name="Energy (kcal/mol)",
 729                error_y=dict(
 730                    type="data",
 731                    array=[dist_std_vals[3].tolist()],
 732                    width=0.25,
 733                    visible=True,
 734                ),
 735            ),
 736            row=1,
 737            col=2,
 738        )
 739        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=1, col=2)
 740
 741        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="kcal/mol", range=[0, 8], row=1, col=2)
 742
 743        fig.add_trace(
 744            go.Bar(
 745                x=["Cα Distance (Å)", "Cβ Distance (Å)", "Sγ Distance (Å)"],
 746                y=[dist_mean_vals[0], dist_mean_vals[1], dist_mean_vals[2]],
 747                name="Distances (Å)",
 748                error_y=dict(
 749                    type="data",
 750                    array=[
 751                        dist_std_vals[0].tolist(),
 752                        dist_std_vals[1].tolist(),
 753                        dist_std_vals[2].tolist(),
 754                    ],
 755                    width=0.25,
 756                    visible=True,
 757                ),
 758            ),
 759            row=2,
 760            col=1,
 761        )
 762        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Distance (A)", range=[0, 8], row=2, col=1)
 763        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=1)
 764
 765        fig.add_trace(
 766            go.Bar(
 767                x=["Torsion Length (Å)"],
 768                y=[tor_mean_vals[5]],
 769                name="Torsion Length (Å)",
 770                error_y=dict(
 771                    type="data", array=[tor_std_vals[5]], width=0.25, visible=True
 772                ),
 773            ),
 774            row=2,
 775            col=2,
 776        )
 777        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Torsion Length", range=[0, 350], row=2, col=2)
 778        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=2)
 779
 780        fig.update_traces(
 781            error_y_thickness=2,
 782            error_y_color="gray",
 783            texttemplate="%{y:.2f} ± %{error_y.array:.2f}",
 784            textposition="outside",
 785        )
 786
 787        if display:
 788            fig.show()
 789
 790        if save:
 791            fig.write_image(fname)
 792
 793    @staticmethod
 794    def plot_distances(
 795        distances,
 796        distance_type="sg",
 797        cutoff=-1,
 798        comparison="less",
 799        theme="auto",
 800        log=True,
 801    ):
 802        """Plot the distance values as a histogram.
 803
 804        :param distances: List of distance values
 805        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca')
 806        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for the x-axis title
 807        :param comparison: If 'less', show distances less than cutoff
 808        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
 809        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
 810        """
 811        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 812        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
 813        flip = False if comparison == "less" else True
 814
 815        match distance_type:
 816            case "sg":
 817                column_name = "SG Distance"
 818                title = "Sγ Distance Distribution"
 819                if cutoff == -1.0:
 820                    xtitle = "Sγ-Sγ Distances, (no cutoff)"
 821                else:
 822                    xtitle = (
 823                        f"Sγ Distance < {cutoff} Å"
 824                        if not flip
 825                        else f"Sγ-Sγ Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
 826                    )
 827            case "ca":
 828                column_name = "Ca Distance"
 829                title = "Cα Distance Distribution"
 830                if cutoff == -1.0:
 831                    xtitle = "Cα-Cα Distances, (no cutoff)"
 832                else:
 833                    xtitle = (
 834                        f"Cα Distance < {cutoff} Å"
 835                        if not flip
 836                        else f"Cα-Cα Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
 837                    )
 838            case _:
 839                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
 840
 841        df = pd.DataFrame(distances, columns=[column_name])
 842
 843        fig = px.histogram(
 844            df,
 845            x=column_name,
 846            nbins=NBINS,
 847            title=title,
 848        )
 849        fig.update_layout(
 850            title={"text": "Distance Distribution", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
 851            xaxis_title=xtitle,
 852            yaxis_title="Frequency",
 853            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
 854            bargap=0.2,
 855        )
 856        fig.show()
 857
 858    @staticmethod
 859    def plot_deviation_scatterplots(df: pd.DataFrame, theme="auto") -> go.Figure:
 860        """Plot scatter plots for Bondlength_Deviation, Angle_Deviation, Ca_Distance, and Sg_Distance.
 861
 862        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviation information
 863        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 864        :return: Figure containing the scatter plots
 865        """
 866        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 867        dotsize = 2
 868
 869        fig = px.scatter(
 870            df, x=df.index, y="Bondlength_Deviation", title="Bondlength Deviation"
 871        )
 872        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Bondlength Deviation")
 873        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 874        fig.show()
 875
 876        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Angle_Deviation", title="Angle Deviation")
 877        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Angle Deviation")
 878        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 879        fig.show()
 880
 881        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Ca_Distance", title="Cα Distance")
 882        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Cα Distance")
 883        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 884        fig.show()
 885
 886        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Sg_Distance", title="Sg Distance")
 887        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Sg Distance")
 888        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 889        fig.show()
 890
 891        return fig

 893    @staticmethod
 894    def plot_deviation_histograms(df: pd.DataFrame, theme="auto", log=True) -> None:
 895        """Plot histograms for Bondlength_Deviation and Angle_Deviation with normal distribution overlay.
 896
 897        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviation information
 898        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
 899        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
 900        """
 901        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 902        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
 903
 904        def create_histogram_with_normal(data, column_name, title, x_label):
 905            fig = px.histogram(
 906                data,
 907                x=column_name,
 908                nbins=NBINS,
 909                title=title,
 910            )
 911
 912            mean = np.mean(data[column_name])
 913            std = np.std(data[column_name])
 914            x = np.linspace(data[column_name].min(), data[column_name].max(), 100)
 915            y = stats.norm.pdf(x, mean, std)
 916
 917            hist, _ = np.histogram(data[column_name], bins=NBINS)
 918            scaling_factor = np.max(hist) / np.max(y)
 919            y_scaled = y * scaling_factor
 920
 921            fig.add_trace(
 922                go.Scatter(x=x, y=y_scaled, mode="lines", name="Normal Distribution")
 923            )
 924
 925            fig.update_layout(
 926                title={"text": title, "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
 927                xaxis_title=x_label,
 928                yaxis_title="Frequency",
 929                yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
 930            )
 931
 932            if log:
 933                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.log10(np.max(hist))])
 934            else:
 935                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.max(hist)])
 936
 937            return fig
 938
 939        fig_bond_length = create_histogram_with_normal(
 940            df,
 941            "Bondlength_Deviation",
 942            "Bond Length Deviation",
 943            "Bond Length Deviation (Å)",
 944        )
 945        fig_bond_length.show()
 946
 947        fig_bond_angle = create_histogram_with_normal(
 948            df, "Angle_Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation (°)"
 949        )
 950        fig_bond_angle.show()
 951
 952    @staticmethod
 953    def _render_sslist(pl, sslist, style, res=100, panelsize=WINSIZE):
 954        """Internal rendering engine that calculates and instantiates all bond
 955        cylinders and atomic sphere meshes.
 956
 957        :param pl: PyVista plotter object
 958        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 959        :param style: Rendering style
 960        :param res: Resolution for rendering
 961        :param panelsize: Size of each panel
 962        :return: Updated plotter object
 963        """
 964        _ssList = sslist
 965        tot_ss = len(_ssList)
 966        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 967
 968        if tot_ss > 30:
 969            res = 60
 970        if tot_ss > 60:
 971            res = 30
 972        if tot_ss > 90:
 973            res = 12
 974
 975        total_plots = rows * cols
 976        for idx in range(min(tot_ss, total_plots)):
 977            r = idx // cols
 978            c = idx % cols
 979            pl.subplot(r, c)
 980
 981            ss = _ssList[idx]
 982            src = ss.pdb_id
 983            enrg = ss.energy
 984            title = f"{src} {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: E: {enrg:.2f}, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
 985            fontsize = calculate_fontsize(title, panelsize)
 986            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
 987            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
 988                ss,
 989                pl,
 990                style=style,
 991                res=res,
 992            )
 993
 994        return pl
 995
 996    @staticmethod
 997    def _render_ss(
 998        ss,
 999        pvplot: pv.Plotter,
1000        style="bs",
1001        plain=False,
1002        bondcolor=BOND_COLOR,
1003        bs_scale=BS_SCALE,
1004        spec=SPECULARITY,
1005        specpow=SPEC_POWER,
1006        translate=True,
1007        bond_radius=BOND_RADIUS,
1008        res=100,
1009    ):
1010        """
1011        Update the passed pyVista plotter() object with the mesh data for the
1012        input Disulfide Bond. Used internally.
1013
1014        :param pvplot: pyvista.Plotter object
1015        :type pvplot: pv.Plotter
1016
1017        :param style: Rendering style, by default 'bs'. One of 'bs', 'st', 'cpk'. Render as \
1018            CPK, ball-and-stick or stick. Bonds are colored by atom color, unless \
1019            'plain' is specified.
1020        :type style: str, optional
1021
1022        :param plain: Used internally, by default False
1023        :type plain: bool, optional
1024
1025        :param bondcolor: pyVista color name, optional bond color for simple bonds, by default BOND_COLOR
1026        :type bondcolor: str, optional
1027
1028        :param bs_scale: Scale factor (0-1) to reduce the atom sizes for ball and stick, by default BS_SCALE
1029        :type bs_scale: float, optional
1030
1031        :param spec: Specularity (0-1), where 1 is totally smooth and 0 is rough, by default SPECULARITY
1032        :type spec: float, optional
1033
1034        :param specpow: Exponent used for specularity calculations, by default SPEC_POWER
1035        :type specpow: int, optional
1036
1037        :param translate: Flag used internally to indicate if we should translate \
1038            the disulfide to its geometric center of mass, by default True.
1039        :type translate: bool, optional
1040
1041        :returns: Updated pv.Plotter object with atoms and bonds.
1042        :rtype: pv.Plotter
1043        """
1044
1045        def add_atoms(pvp, coords, atoms, radii, colors, spec, specpow):
1046            for i, atom in enumerate(atoms):
1047                rad = radii[atom]
1048                if style == "bs" and i > 11:
1049                    rad *= 0.75
1050                pvp.add_mesh(
1051                    pv.Sphere(center=coords[i], radius=rad),
1052                    color=colors[atom],
1053                    smooth_shading=True,
1054                    specular=spec,
1055                    specular_power=specpow,
1056                )
1057
1058        def draw_bonds(
1059            ss,
1060            pvp,
1061            coords,
1062            bond_radius=BOND_RADIUS,
1063            style="sb",
1064            bcolor=BOND_COLOR,
1065            all_atoms=True,
1066            res=100,
1067        ):
1068            """
1069            Generate the appropriate pyVista cylinder objects to represent
1070            a particular disulfide bond. This utilizes a connection table
1071            for the starting and ending atoms and a color table for the
1072            bond colors. Used internally.
1073
1074            :param pvp: input plotter object to be updated
1075            :param bradius: bond radius
1076            :param style: bond style. One of sb, plain, pd
1077            :param bcolor: pyvista color
1078            :param missing: True if atoms are missing, False othersie
1079            :param all_atoms: True if rendering O, False if only backbone rendered
1080
1081            :return pvp: Updated Plotter object.
1082
1083            """
1084            _bond_conn = np.array(
1085                [
1086                    [0, 1],  # n-ca
1087                    [1, 2],  # ca-c
1088                    [2, 3],  # c-o
1089                    [1, 4],  # ca-cb
1090                    [4, 5],  # cb-sg
1091                    [6, 7],  # n-ca
1092                    [7, 8],  # ca-c
1093                    [8, 9],  # c-o
1094                    [7, 10],  # ca-cb
1095                    [10, 11],  # cb-sg
1096                    [5, 11],  # sg -sg
1097                    [12, 0],  # cprev_prox-n
1098                    [2, 13],  # c-nnext_prox
1099                    [14, 6],  # cprev_dist-n_dist
1100                    [8, 15],  # c-nnext_dist
1101                ]
1102            )
1103
1104            # modeled disulfides only have backbone atoms since
1105            # phi and psi are undefined, which makes the carbonyl
1106            # oxygen (O) undefined as well. Their previous and next N
1107            # are also undefined.
1108
1109            missing = ss.missing_atoms
1110            bradius = bond_radius
1111
1112            _bond_conn_backbone = np.array(
1113                [
1114                    [0, 1],  # n-ca
1115                    [1, 2],  # ca-c
1116                    [1, 4],  # ca-cb
1117                    [4, 5],  # cb-sg
1118                    [6, 7],  # n-ca
1119                    [7, 8],  # ca-c
1120                    [7, 10],  # ca-cb
1121                    [10, 11],  # cb-sg
1122                    [5, 11],  # sg -sg
1123                ]
1124            )
1125
1126            # colors for the bonds. Index into ATOM_COLORS array
1127            _bond_split_colors = np.array(
1128                [
1129                    ("N", "C"),
1130                    ("C", "C"),
1131                    ("C", "O"),
1132                    ("C", "C"),
1133                    ("C", "SG"),
1134                    ("N", "C"),
1135                    ("C", "C"),
1136                    ("C", "O"),
1137                    ("C", "C"),
1138                    ("C", "SG"),
1139                    ("SG", "SG"),
1140                    # prev and next C-N bonds - color by atom Z
1141                    ("C", "N"),
1142                    ("C", "N"),
1143                    ("C", "N"),
1144                    ("C", "N"),
1145                ]
1146            )
1147
1148            _bond_split_colors_backbone = np.array(
1149                [
1150                    ("N", "C"),
1151                    ("C", "C"),
1152                    ("C", "C"),
1153                    ("C", "SG"),
1154                    ("N", "C"),
1155                    ("C", "C"),
1156                    ("C", "C"),
1157                    ("C", "SG"),
1158                    ("SG", "SG"),
1159                ]
1160            )
1161            # work through connectivity and colors
1162            orig_col = dest_col = bcolor
1163
1164            if all_atoms:
1165                bond_conn = _bond_conn
1166                bond_split_colors = _bond_split_colors
1167            else:
1168                bond_conn = _bond_conn_backbone
1169                bond_split_colors = _bond_split_colors_backbone
1170
1171            for i, bond in enumerate(bond_conn):
1172                if all_atoms:
1173                    if i > 10 and missing:  # skip missing atoms
1174                        continue
1175
1176                orig, dest = bond
1177                col = bond_split_colors[i]
1178
1179                # get the coords
1180                prox_pos = coords[orig]
1181                distal_pos = coords[dest]
1182
1183                # compute a direction vector
1184                direction = distal_pos - prox_pos
1185
1186                # compute vector length. divide by 2 since split bond
1187                height = math.dist(prox_pos, distal_pos) / 2.0
1188
1189                # the cylinder origins are actually in the
1190                # middle so we translate
1191
1192                origin = prox_pos + 0.5 * direction  # for a single plain bond
1193                origin1 = prox_pos + 0.25 * direction
1194                origin2 = prox_pos + 0.75 * direction
1195
1196                if style == "plain":
1197                    orig_col = dest_col = bcolor
1198
1199                # proximal-distal red/green coloring
1200                elif style == "pd":
1201                    if i <= 4 or i == 11 or i == 12:
1202                        orig_col = dest_col = "red"
1203                    else:
1204                        orig_col = dest_col = "green"
1205                    if i == 10:
1206                        orig_col = dest_col = "yellow"
1207                else:
1208                    orig_col = ATOM_COLORS[col[0]]
1209                    dest_col = ATOM_COLORS[col[1]]
1210
1211                if i >= 11:  # prev and next residue atoms for phi/psi calcs
1212                    bradius = bradius * 0.5  # make smaller to distinguish
1213
1214                cap1 = pv.Sphere(center=prox_pos, radius=bradius)
1215                cap2 = pv.Sphere(center=distal_pos, radius=bradius)
1216
1217                if style == "plain":
1218                    cyl = pv.Cylinder(
1219                        origin, direction, radius=bradius, height=height * 2.0
1220                    )
1221                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl, color=orig_col)
1222                else:
1223                    cyl1 = pv.Cylinder(
1224                        origin1,
1225                        direction,
1226                        radius=bradius,
1227                        height=height,
1228                        capping=False,
1229                        resolution=res,
1230                    )
1231                    cyl2 = pv.Cylinder(
1232                        origin2,
1233                        direction,
1234                        radius=bradius,
1235                        height=height,
1236                        capping=False,
1237                        resolution=res,
1238                    )
1239                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl1, color=orig_col)
1240                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl2, color=dest_col)
1241
1242                pvp.add_mesh(cap1, color=orig_col)
1243                pvp.add_mesh(cap2, color=dest_col)
1244
1245            return pvp  # end draw_bonds
1246
1247        model = ss.modelled
1248        coords = ss.internal_coords
1249        if translate:
1250            coords -= ss.cofmass
1251
1252        atoms = (
1253            "N",
1254            "C",
1255            "C",
1256            "O",
1257            "C",
1258            "SG",
1259            "N",
1260            "C",
1261            "C",
1262            "O",
1263            "C",
1264            "SG",
1265            "C",
1266            "N",
1267            "C",
1268            "N",
1269        )
1270        pvp = pvplot
1271        all_atoms = not model
1272
1273        if style == "cpk":
1274            add_atoms(pvp, coords, atoms, ATOM_RADII_CPK, ATOM_COLORS, spec, specpow)
1275        elif style == "cov":
1276            add_atoms(
1277                pvp, coords, atoms, ATOM_RADII_COVALENT, ATOM_COLORS, spec, specpow
1278            )
1279        elif style == "bs":
1280            add_atoms(
1281                pvp,
1282                coords,
1283                atoms,
1284                {atom: ATOM_RADII_CPK[atom] * bs_scale for atom in atoms},
1285                ATOM_COLORS,
1286                spec,
1287                specpow,
1288            )
1289            pvp = draw_bonds(
1290                ss,
1291                pvp,
1292                coords,
1293                style="bs",
1294                all_atoms=all_atoms,
1295                bond_radius=bond_radius,
1296            )
1297        elif style in ["sb", "pd", "plain"]:
1298            pvp = draw_bonds(
1299                ss,
1300                pvp,
1301                coords,
1302                style=style,
1303                all_atoms=all_atoms,
1304                bond_radius=bond_radius,
1305                bcolor=bondcolor if style == "plain" else None,
1306            )
1307
1308        return pvp
1309
1310    @staticmethod
1311    def display_ss(
1312        ss, single=True, style="sb", light="auto", shadows=False, winsize=WINSIZE
1313    ) -> None:
1314        """
1315        Display the Disulfide bond in the specific rendering style.
1316        :param ss: Disulfide object
1317        :param single: Display the bond in a single panel in the specific style.
1318        :param style:  Rendering style: One of:
1319            * 'sb' - split bonds
1320            * 'bs' - ball and stick
1321            * 'cpk' - CPK style
1322            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1323            * 'plain' - boring single color
1324        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
1325
1326        Example:
1327        >>> import proteusPy as pp
1328
1329        >>> PDB_SS = pp.Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)
1330        >>> ss = PDB_SS[0]
1331        >>> ss.display(style='cpk', light="auto")
1332        >>> ss.screenshot(style='bs', fname='proteus_logo_sb.png')
1333        """
1334
1335        src = ss.pdb_id
1336        enrg = ss.energy
1337
1338        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol. Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å Cβ: {ss.cb_distance:.2f} Å, Sg: {ss.sg_distance:.2f} Å Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
1339
1340        set_pyvista_theme(light)
1341        fontsize = 8
1342
1343        if single:
1344            _pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize)
1345            _pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1346            _pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1347
1348            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1349                ss,
1350                _pl,
1351                style=style,
1352            )
1353            _pl.reset_camera()
1354            if shadows:
1355                _pl.enable_shadows()
1356            _pl.show()
1357
1358        else:
1359            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(2, 2))
1360            pl.subplot(0, 0)
1361
1362            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1363            pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1364
1365            # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
1366
1367            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1368                ss,
1369                pl,
1370                style="cpk",
1371            )
1372
1373            pl.subplot(0, 1)
1374            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1375
1376            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1377                ss,
1378                pl,
1379                style="bs",
1380            )
1381
1382            pl.subplot(1, 0)
1383            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1384
1385            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1386                ss,
1387                pl,
1388                style="sb",
1389            )
1390
1391            pl.subplot(1, 1)
1392            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1393
1394            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1395                ss,
1396                pl,
1397                style="pd",
1398            )
1399
1400            pl.link_views()
1401            pl.reset_camera()
1402            if shadows:
1403                pl.enable_shadows()
1404            pl.show()
1405        return

1407    @staticmethod
1408    def make_movie(
1409        ss, style="sb", fname="ssbond.mp4", verbose=False, steps=360
1410    ) -> None:
1411        """
1412        Create an animation for ```self``` rotating one revolution about the Y axis,
1413        in the given ```style```, saving to ```filename```.
1414
1415        :param style: Rendering style, defaults to 'sb', one of:
1416        * 'sb' - split bonds
1417        * 'bs' - ball and stick
1418        * 'cpk' - CPK style
1419        * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1420        * 'plain' - boring single color
1421
1422        :param fname: Output filename, defaults to ```ssbond.mp4```
1423        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to False
1424        :param steps: Number of steps for one complete rotation, defaults to 360.
1425        """
1426
1427        # src = self.pdb_id
1428        # name = self.name
1429        # enrg = self.energy
1430        # title = f"{src} {name}: {self.proximal}{self.proximal_chain}-{self.distal}{self.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Cα: {self.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {self.torsion_length:.2f}"
1431
1432        if verbose:
1433            print(f"Rendering animation to {fname}...")
1434
1435        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True, theme="document")
1436        pl.open_movie(fname)
1437        path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=steps)
1438
1439        #
1440        # pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1441        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1442        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1443            ss,
1444            pl,
1445            style=style,
1446        )
1447        pl.reset_camera()
1448        pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
1449        pl.close()
1450
1451        if verbose:
1452            print(f"Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")

1454    @staticmethod
1455    def spin(ss, style="sb", verbose=False, steps=360, theme="auto") -> None:
1456        """
1457        Spin the object by rotating it one revolution about the Y axis in the given style.
1458
1459        :param style: Rendering style, defaults to 'sb', one of:
1460            * 'sb' - split bonds
1461            * 'bs' - ball and stick
1462            * 'cpk' - CPK style
1463            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1464            * 'plain' - boring single color
1465
1466        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to False
1467        :param steps: Number of steps for one complete rotation, defaults to 360.
1468        """
1469
1470        src = ss.pdb_id
1471        enrg = ss.energy
1472
1473        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}"
1474
1475        set_pyvista_theme(theme)
1476
1477        if verbose:
1478            _logger.info("Spinning object: %d steps...", steps)
1479
1480        # Create a Plotter instance
1481        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
1482        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1483
1484        # Enable anti-aliasing for smoother rendering
1485        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1486
1487        # Generate an orbital path for spinning
1488        path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=steps)
1489
1490        # Render the object in the specified style
1491        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(ss, pl, style=style)
1492
1493        pl.reset_camera()
1494        pl.show(auto_close=False)
1495
1496        # Orbit the camera along the generated path
1497        pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=False, step=1 / steps)
1498
1499        if verbose:
1500            print("Spinning completed.")

1502    @staticmethod
1503    def screenshot(
1504        ss,
1505        single=True,
1506        style="sb",
1507        fname="ssbond.png",
1508        verbose=False,
1509        shadows=False,
1510        light="Auto",
1511    ) -> None:
1512        """
1513        Create and save a screenshot of the Disulfide in the given style
1514        and filename
1515
1516        :param single: Display a single vs panel view, defaults to True
1517        :param style: Rendering style, one of:
1518        * 'sb' - split bonds
1519        * 'bs' - ball and stick
1520        * 'cpk' - CPK style
1521        * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1522        * 'plain' - boring single color,
1523        :param fname: output filename,, defaults to 'ssbond.png'
1524        :param verbose: Verbosit, defaults to False
1525        :param shadows: Enable shadows, defaults to False
1526        """
1527
1528        src = ss.pdb_id
1529        enrg = ss.energy
1530        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Cβ: {ss.cb_distance:.2f} Å, Sγ: {ss.sg_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}"
1531
1532        set_pyvista_theme(light)
1533
1534        if verbose:
1535            _logger.info("Rendering screenshot to file {fname}")
1536
1537        if single:
1538            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
1539            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1540            pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1541            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1542                ss,
1543                pl,
1544                style=style,
1545            )
1546            pl.reset_camera()
1547            if shadows:
1548                pl.enable_shadows()
1549
1550            pl.show(auto_close=False)  # allows for manipulation
1551            # Take the screenshot after ensuring the plotter is still active
1552            try:
1553                pl.screenshot(fname)
1554            except RuntimeError as e:
1555                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
1556
1557        else:
1558            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, shape=(2, 2), off_screen=False)
1559            pl.subplot(0, 0)
1560
1561            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1562            pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1563
1564            # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
1565            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1566                ss,
1567                pl,
1568                style="cpk",
1569            )
1570
1571            pl.subplot(0, 1)
1572            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1573            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1574                ss,
1575                pl,
1576                style="pd",
1577            )
1578
1579            pl.subplot(1, 0)
1580            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1581            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1582                ss,
1583                pl,
1584                style="bs",
1585            )
1586
1587            pl.subplot(1, 1)
1588            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1589            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1590                ss,
1591                pl,
1592                style="sb",
1593            )
1594
1595            pl.link_views()
1596            pl.reset_camera()
1597            if shadows:
1598                pl.enable_shadows()
1599
1600            # Take the screenshot after ensuring the plotter is still active
1601            pl.show(auto_close=False)  # allows for manipulation
1602

class DisulfideVisualization: 
  58class DisulfideVisualization:
  59    """Provides visualization methods for Disulfide bonds, including 3D rendering,
  60    statistical plots, and overlay displays."""
  61
  62    @staticmethod
  63    def enumerate_class_fromlist(tclass: DisulfideClassManager, sslist, base=8):
  64        """Enumerate the classes from a list of class IDs.
  65
  66        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
  67        :param sslist: List of class IDs to enumerate
  68        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
  69        :return: DataFrame with class IDs and counts
  70        """
  71        x = []
  72        y = []
  73
  74        for cls in sslist:
  75            if cls is not None:
  76                _y = tclass.sslist_from_classid(cls, base=base)
  77                # it's possible to have 0 SS in a class
  78                if _y is not None:
  79                    # only append if we have both.
  80                    x.append(cls)
  81                    y.append(len(_y))
  82
  83        sslist_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=["class_id", "count"])
  84        sslist_df["class_id"] = x
  85        sslist_df["count"] = y
  86        return sslist_df
  87
  88    @staticmethod
  89    def plot_classes_vs_cutoff(
  90        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
  91        cutoff: float,
  92        steps: int = 50,
  93        base=8,
  94        theme="auto",
  95        verbose=False,
  96    ) -> None:
  97        """Plot the total percentage and number of members for each octant class against the cutoff value.
  98
  99        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 100        :param cutoff: Percent cutoff value for filtering the classes
 101        :param steps: Number of steps to take in the cutoff
 102        :param base: The base class to use, 6 or 8
 103        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot ('auto', 'light', or 'dark')
 104        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 105        :return: None
 106        """
 107        _cutoff = np.linspace(0, cutoff, steps)
 108        tot_list = []
 109        members_list = []
 110        base_str = "Octant" if base == 8 else "Binary"
 111
 112        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 113
 114        for c in _cutoff:
 115            class_df = tclass.filter_class_by_percentage(c, base=base)
 116            tot = class_df["percentage"].sum()
 117            tot_list.append(tot)
 118            members_list.append(class_df.shape[0])
 119            if verbose:
 120                print(
 121                    f"Cutoff: {c:5.3} accounts for {tot:7.2f}% and is {class_df.shape[0]:5} members long."
 122                )
 123
 124        fig = go.Figure()
 125
 126        # Add total percentage trace
 127        fig.add_trace(
 128            go.Scatter(
 129                x=_cutoff,
 130                y=tot_list,
 131                mode="lines+markers",
 132                name="Total percentage",
 133                yaxis="y1",
 134                line=dict(color="blue"),
 135            )
 136        )
 137
 138        # Add number of members trace
 139        fig.add_trace(
 140            go.Scatter(
 141                x=_cutoff,
 142                y=members_list,
 143                mode="lines+markers",
 144                name="Number of members",
 145                yaxis="y2",
 146                line=dict(color="red"),
 147            )
 148        )
 149
 150        # Update layout
 151        fig.update_layout(
 152            title={
 153                "text": f"{base_str} Classes vs Cutoff, ({cutoff}%)",
 154                "x": 0.5,
 155                "yanchor": "top",
 156                "xanchor": "center",
 157            },
 158            xaxis=dict(title="Cutoff"),
 159            yaxis=dict(
 160                title="Total percentage",
 161                titlefont=dict(color="blue"),
 162                tickfont=dict(color="blue"),
 163            ),
 164            yaxis2=dict(
 165                title="Number of members",
 166                titlefont=dict(color="red"),
 167                tickfont=dict(color="red"),
 168                overlaying="y",
 169                side="right",
 170                type="log",
 171            ),
 172            legend=dict(x=0.75, y=1.16),
 173        )
 174
 175        fig.show()
 176
 177    @staticmethod
 178    def plot_binary_to_eightclass_incidence(
 179        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
 180        theme="light",
 181        save=False,
 182        savedir=".",
 183        verbose=False,
 184    ):
 185        """Plot the incidence of all octant Disulfide classes for a given binary class.
 186
 187        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 188        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 189        :param save: Whether to save the plots
 190        :param savedir: Directory to save plots to
 191        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 192        """
 193        if verbose:
 194            _logger.setLevel("INFO")
 195
 196        clslist = tclass.binaryclass_df["class_id"]
 197        for cls in clslist:
 198            eightcls = tclass.binary_to_class(cls, 8)
 199            df = DisulfideVisualization.enumerate_class_fromlist(
 200                tclass, eightcls, base=8
 201            )
 202            DisulfideVisualization.plot_count_vs_class_df(
 203                df,
 204                title=cls,
 205                theme=theme,
 206                save=save,
 207                savedir=savedir,
 208                base=8,
 209                verbose=verbose,
 210            )
 211        if verbose:
 212            _logger.info("Graph generation complete.")
 213            _logger.setLevel("WARNING")

 215    @staticmethod
 216    def plot_count_vs_class_df(
 217        df,
 218        title="title",
 219        theme="auto",
 220        save=False,
 221        savedir=".",
 222        base=8,
 223        verbose=False,
 224        log=True,
 225    ):
 226        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly for the given disulfide class.
 227
 228        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
 229        :param title: Title for the plot
 230        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 231        :param save: Whether to save the plot
 232        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
 233        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 234        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 235        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 236        """
 237        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 238
 239        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
 240        _labels = {}
 241        _prefix = "None"
 242        if base == 8:
 243            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 244            _prefix = "Octant"
 245        elif base == 2:
 246            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 247            _prefix = "Binary"
 248        else:
 249            raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8.")
 250
 251        fig = px.line(
 252            df,
 253            x="class_id",
 254            y="count",
 255            title=f"{_title}",
 256            labels=_labels,
 257        )
 258
 259        fig.update_layout(
 260            showlegend=True,
 261            title_x=0.5,
 262            title_font=dict(size=20),
 263            xaxis_showgrid=False,
 264            yaxis_showgrid=False,
 265            autosize=True,
 266            yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 267        )
 268        fig.update_layout(autosize=True)
 269
 270        if save:
 271            fname = Path(savedir) / f"{title}_{_prefix}.png"
 272
 273            if verbose:
 274                _logger.info("Saving %s plot to %s", title, fname)
 275            fig.write_image(fname, "png")
 276        else:
 277            fig.show()

 347    @staticmethod
 348    def plot_count_vs_class_df_paginated(
 349        df,
 350        title="title",
 351        theme="auto",
 352        save=False,
 353        savedir=".",
 354        base=8,
 355        verbose=False,
 356        log=True,
 357        page_size=200,
 358    ):
 359        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly with pagination.
 360
 361        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
 362        :param title: Title for the plot
 363        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 364        :param save: Whether to save the plot
 365        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
 366        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 367        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
 368        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 369        :param page_size: Number of items per page
 370        """
 371        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 372
 373        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
 374        _labels = {}
 375        _prefix = "None"
 376        if base == 8:
 377            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 378            _prefix = "Octant"
 379        elif base == 2:
 380            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}
 381            _prefix = "Binary"
 382        else:
 383            raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8.")
 384
 385        total_pages = (len(df) + page_size - 1) // page_size
 386
 387        for page in range(total_pages):
 388            start = page * page_size
 389            end = start + page_size
 390            df_page = df.iloc[start:end]
 391
 392            fig = px.line(
 393                df_page,
 394                x="class_id",
 395                y="count",
 396                title=f"{_title} (Page {page + 1}/{total_pages})",
 397                labels=_labels,
 398            )
 399
 400            fig.update_layout(
 401                showlegend=True,
 402                title_x=0.5,
 403                title_font=dict(size=20),
 404                xaxis_showgrid=False,
 405                yaxis_showgrid=False,
 406                autosize=True,
 407                yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 408            )
 409            fig.update_layout(autosize=True)
 410
 411            if save:
 412                fname = Path(savedir) / f"{title}_{_prefix}_page_{page + 1}.png"
 413
 414                if verbose:
 415                    _logger.info("Saving %s plot to %s", title, fname)
 416                fig.write_image(fname, "png")
 417            else:
 418                fig.show()

 420    @staticmethod
 421    def plot_count_vs_classid(
 422        tclass: DisulfideClassManager, cls=None, theme="auto", base=8, log=True
 423    ):
 424        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly.
 425
 426        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 427        :param cls: Specific class to plot (optional)
 428        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 429        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 430        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 431        """
 432        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 433
 434        _title = None
 435
 436        match base:
 437            case 8:
 438                _title = "Octant Class Distribution"
 439            case 2:
 440                _title = "Binary Class Distribution"
 441            case _:
 442                raise ValueError("Invalid base. Must be 2 or 8")
 443
 444        df = tclass.binaryclass_df if base == 2 else tclass.eightclass_df
 445
 446        if cls is None:
 447            fig = px.line(df, x="class_id", y="count", title=_title)
 448        else:
 449            subset = df[df["class_id"] == cls]
 450            fig = px.line(subset, x="class_id", y="count", title=_title)
 451
 452        fig.update_layout(
 453            xaxis_title="Class ID",
 454            yaxis_title="Count",
 455            showlegend=True,
 456            title_x=0.5,
 457            autosize=True,
 458            yaxis_type="log" if log else "linear",
 459        )
 460
 461        fig.show()

 463    @staticmethod
 464    def plot_disulfides_vs_pdbid(ssdict, cutoff=1):
 465        """Plot the number of disulfides versus PDB ID.
 466
 467        :param ssdict: Dictionary mapping PDB IDs to disulfide indices
 468        :param cutoff: Minimum number of disulfides required for inclusion
 469        :return: Tuple of (pdb_ids, num_disulfides)
 470        """
 471        pdbids = []
 472        num_disulfides = []
 473
 474        for pdbid, disulfides in ssdict.items():
 475            if len(disulfides) > cutoff:
 476                pdbids.append(pdbid)
 477                num_disulfides.append(len(disulfides))
 478
 479        # Create a DataFrame
 480        df = pd.DataFrame({"PDB ID": pdbids, "Number of Disulfides": num_disulfides})
 481        fig = px.bar(
 482            df,
 483            x="PDB ID",
 484            y="Number of Disulfides",
 485            title=f"Disulfides vs PDB ID with cutoff: {cutoff}, {len(pdbids)} PDB IDs",
 486        )
 487        fig.update_layout(
 488            xaxis_title="PDB ID",
 489            yaxis_title="Number of Disulfides",
 490            xaxis_tickangle=-90,
 491        )
 492        fig.show()
 493
 494        return pdbids, num_disulfides
