 496    @staticmethod
 497    def plot_classes(
 498        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
 499        class_string,
 500        base=8,
 501        theme="auto",
 502        log=False,
 503        page_size=200,
 504    ):
 505        """Plot the distribution of classes for the given class string.
 506
 507        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
 508        :param class_string: The class string to plot
 509        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
 510        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
 511        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
 512        :param page_size: Number of items per page
 513        """
 514        classlist = tclass.binary_to_class(class_string, base)
 515        df = DisulfideVisualization.enumerate_class_fromlist(
 516            tclass, classlist, base=base
 517        )
 518        DisulfideVisualization.plot_count_vs_class_df_paginated(
 519            df, title=class_string, theme=theme, base=base, log=log, page_size=page_size
 520        )
 521
 522    @staticmethod
 523    def display_sslist(sslist, style="sb", light="auto", panelsize=512):
 524        """Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
 525
 526        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 527        :param style: Rendering style: One of:
 528            - 'sb' - split bonds
 529            - 'bs' - ball and stick
 530            - 'cpk' - CPK style
 531            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
 532            - 'plain' - boring single color
 533        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
 534        :param panelsize: Size of each panel in pixels
 535        """
 536        ssbonds = sslist
 537        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number of ssbonds
 538        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 539        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
 540
 541        set_pyvista_theme(light)
 542
 543        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
 544        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_sslist(
 545            pl, sslist, style, panelsize=panelsize
 546        )
 547        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 548
 549        pl.link_views()
 550        pl.reset_camera()
 551        pl.show()
 552
 553    @staticmethod
 554    def display_overlay(
 555        sslist,
 556        screenshot=False,
 557        movie=False,
 558        verbose=False,
 559        fname="ss_overlay.png",
 560        light="auto",
 561        winsize=WINSIZE,
 562    ):
 563        """Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
 564        a common coordinate frame.
 565
 566        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 567        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot
 568        :param movie: Save a movie
 569        :param verbose: Verbosity
 570        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot
 571        :param light: Background color
 572        :param winsize: Window size tuple (width, height)
 573        """
 574        pid = sslist.pdb_id
 575        ssbonds = sslist
 576        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)
 577        avg_enrg = sslist.average_energy
 578        avg_dist = sslist.average_distance
 579        resolution = sslist.average_resolution
 580
 581        res = 64
 582        if tot_ss > 30:
 583            res = 48
 584        if tot_ss > 60:
 585            res = 16
 586        if tot_ss > 90:
 587            res = 8
 588
 589        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 590        fontsize = calculate_fontsize(title, winsize[0])
 591
 592        set_pyvista_theme(light)
 593
 594        if movie:
 595            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=True)
 596        else:
 597            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=False)
 598
 599        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
 600        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 601        pl.add_axes()
 602
 603        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
 604
 605        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
 606        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
 607        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
 608        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
 609
 610        if verbose:
 611            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
 612        else:
 613            pbar = range(tot_ss)
 614
 615        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
 616            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
 617            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
 618                ss,
 619                pl,
 620                style="plain",
 621                bondcolor=color,
 622                translate=False,
 623                bond_radius=brad,
 624                res=res,
 625            )
 626
 627        pl.reset_camera()
 628
 629        if screenshot:
 630            pl.show(auto_close=False)
 631            try:
 632                pl.screenshot(fname)
 633                if verbose:
 634                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
 635            except RuntimeError as e:
 636                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
 637
 638        elif movie:
 639            if verbose:
 640                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 641
 642            pl.open_movie(fname)
 643            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
 644            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
 645            pl.close()
 646
 647            if verbose:
 648                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 649        else:
 650            pl.show()
 651
 652    @staticmethod
 653    def display_torsion_statistics(
 654        sslist,
 655        display=True,
 656        save=False,
 657        fname="ss_torsions.png",
 658        theme="auto",
 659    ):
 660        """Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
 661
 662        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 663        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook
 664        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file
 665        :param fname: The name of the image file to save
 666        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 667        """
 668        if len(sslist) == 0:
 669            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
 670            return
 671
 672        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 673        title = f"{sslist.pdb_id}: {len(sslist)} members"
 674
 675        tor_vals, dist_vals = sslist.calculate_torsion_statistics()
 676
 677        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
 678        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]
 679
 680        dist_mean_vals = dist_vals.loc["mean"]
 681        dist_std_vals = dist_vals.loc["std"]
 682
 683        fig = make_subplots(
 684            rows=2, cols=2, vertical_spacing=0.125, column_widths=[1, 1]
 685        )
 686
 687        fig.update_layout(
 688            title={
 689                "text": title,
 690                "xanchor": "center",
 691                "x": 0.5,
 692                "yanchor": "top",
 693            },
 694            width=1024,
 695            height=1024,
 696        )
 697
 698        fig.add_trace(
 699            go.Bar(
 700                x=["X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5"],
 701                y=tor_mean_vals[:5],
 702                name="Torsion Angle (°) ",
 703                error_y=dict(type="data", array=tor_std_vals, visible=True),
 704            ),
 705            row=1,
 706            col=1,
 707        )
 708
 709        fig.add_trace(
 710            go.Bar(
 711                x=["rho"],
 712                y=[dist_mean_vals[4]],
 713                name="ρ (°)",
 714                error_y=dict(type="data", array=[dist_std_vals[4]], visible=True),
 715            ),
 716            row=1,
 717            col=1,
 718        )
 719
 720        fig.update_yaxes(
 721            title_text="Dihedral Angle (°)", range=[-200, 200], row=1, col=1
 722        )
 723        fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, 320], row=2, col=2)
 724
 725        fig.add_trace(
 726            go.Bar(
 727                x=["Strain Energy (kcal/mol)"],
 728                y=[dist_mean_vals[3]],
 729                name="Energy (kcal/mol)",
 730                error_y=dict(
 731                    type="data",
 732                    array=[dist_std_vals[3].tolist()],
 733                    width=0.25,
 734                    visible=True,
 735                ),
 736            ),
 737            row=1,
 738            col=2,
 739        )
 740        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=1, col=2)
 741
 742        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="kcal/mol", range=[0, 8], row=1, col=2)
 743
 744        fig.add_trace(
 745            go.Bar(
 746                x=["Cα Distance (Å)", "Cβ Distance (Å)", "Sγ Distance (Å)"],
 747                y=[dist_mean_vals[0], dist_mean_vals[1], dist_mean_vals[2]],
 748                name="Distances (Å)",
 749                error_y=dict(
 750                    type="data",
 751                    array=[
 752                        dist_std_vals[0].tolist(),
 753                        dist_std_vals[1].tolist(),
 754                        dist_std_vals[2].tolist(),
 755                    ],
 756                    width=0.25,
 757                    visible=True,
 758                ),
 759            ),
 760            row=2,
 761            col=1,
 762        )
 763        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Distance (A)", range=[0, 8], row=2, col=1)
 764        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=1)
 765
 766        fig.add_trace(
 767            go.Bar(
 768                x=["Torsion Length (Å)"],
 769                y=[tor_mean_vals[5]],
 770                name="Torsion Length (Å)",
 771                error_y=dict(
 772                    type="data", array=[tor_std_vals[5]], width=0.25, visible=True
 773                ),
 774            ),
 775            row=2,
 776            col=2,
 777        )
 778        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Torsion Length", range=[0, 350], row=2, col=2)
 779        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=2)
 780
 781        fig.update_traces(
 782            error_y_thickness=2,
 783            error_y_color="gray",
 784            texttemplate="%{y:.2f} ± %{error_y.array:.2f}",
 785            textposition="outside",
 786        )
 787
 788        if display:
 789            fig.show()
 790
 791        if save:
 792            fig.write_image(fname)

 794    @staticmethod
 795    def plot_distances(
 796        distances,
 797        distance_type="sg",
 798        cutoff=-1,
 799        comparison="less",
 800        theme="auto",
 801        log=True,
 802    ):
 803        """Plot the distance values as a histogram.
 804
 805        :param distances: List of distance values
 806        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca')
 807        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for the x-axis title
 808        :param comparison: If 'less', show distances less than cutoff
 809        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
 810        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
 811        """
 812        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 813        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
 814        flip = False if comparison == "less" else True
 815
 816        match distance_type:
 817            case "sg":
 818                column_name = "SG Distance"
 819                title = "Sγ Distance Distribution"
 820                if cutoff == -1.0:
 821                    xtitle = "Sγ-Sγ Distances, (no cutoff)"
 822                else:
 823                    xtitle = (
 824                        f"Sγ Distance < {cutoff} Å"
 825                        if not flip
 826                        else f"Sγ-Sγ Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
 827                    )
 828            case "ca":
 829                column_name = "Ca Distance"
 830                title = "Cα Distance Distribution"
 831                if cutoff == -1.0:
 832                    xtitle = "Cα-Cα Distances, (no cutoff)"
 833                else:
 834                    xtitle = (
 835                        f"Cα Distance < {cutoff} Å"
 836                        if not flip
 837                        else f"Cα-Cα Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
 838                    )
 839            case _:
 840                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
 841
 842        df = pd.DataFrame(distances, columns=[column_name])
 843
 844        fig = px.histogram(
 845            df,
 846            x=column_name,
 847            nbins=NBINS,
 848            title=title,
 849        )
 850        fig.update_layout(
 851            title={"text": "Distance Distribution", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
 852            xaxis_title=xtitle,
 853            yaxis_title="Frequency",
 854            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
 855            bargap=0.2,
 856        )
 857        fig.show()
 858
 859    @staticmethod
 860    def plot_deviation_scatterplots(df: pd.DataFrame, theme="auto") -> go.Figure:
 861        """Plot scatter plots for Bondlength_Deviation, Angle_Deviation, Ca_Distance, and Sg_Distance.
 862
 863        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviation information
 864        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
 865        :return: Figure containing the scatter plots
 866        """
 867        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 868        dotsize = 2
 869
 870        fig = px.scatter(
 871            df, x=df.index, y="Bondlength_Deviation", title="Bondlength Deviation"
 872        )
 873        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Bondlength Deviation")
 874        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 875        fig.show()
 876
 877        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Angle_Deviation", title="Angle Deviation")
 878        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Angle Deviation")
 879        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 880        fig.show()
 881
 882        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Ca_Distance", title="Cα Distance")
 883        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Cα Distance")
 884        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 885        fig.show()
 886
 887        fig = px.scatter(df, x=df.index, y="Sg_Distance", title="Sg Distance")
 888        fig.update_layout(xaxis_title="Row Index", yaxis_title="Sg Distance")
 889        fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=dotsize))
 890        fig.show()
 891
 892        return fig

 894    @staticmethod
 895    def plot_deviation_histograms(df: pd.DataFrame, theme="auto", log=True) -> None:
 896        """Plot histograms for Bondlength_Deviation and Angle_Deviation with normal distribution overlay.
 897
 898        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviation information
 899        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
 900        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
 901        """
 902        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 903        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
 904
 905        def create_histogram_with_normal(data, column_name, title, x_label):
 906            fig = px.histogram(
 907                data,
 908                x=column_name,
 909                nbins=NBINS,
 910                title=title,
 911            )
 912
 913            mean = np.mean(data[column_name])
 914            std = np.std(data[column_name])
 915            x = np.linspace(data[column_name].min(), data[column_name].max(), 100)
 916            y = stats.norm.pdf(x, mean, std)
 917
 918            hist, _ = np.histogram(data[column_name], bins=NBINS)
 919            scaling_factor = np.max(hist) / np.max(y)
 920            y_scaled = y * scaling_factor
 921
 922            fig.add_trace(
 923                go.Scatter(x=x, y=y_scaled, mode="lines", name="Normal Distribution")
 924            )
 925
 926            fig.update_layout(
 927                title={"text": title, "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
 928                xaxis_title=x_label,
 929                yaxis_title="Frequency",
 930                yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
 931            )
 932
 933            if log:
 934                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.log10(np.max(hist))])
 935            else:
 936                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.max(hist)])
 937
 938            return fig
 939
 940        fig_bond_length = create_histogram_with_normal(
 941            df,
 942            "Bondlength_Deviation",
 943            "Bond Length Deviation",
 944            "Bond Length Deviation (Å)",
 945        )
 946        fig_bond_length.show()
 947
 948        fig_bond_angle = create_histogram_with_normal(
 949            df, "Angle_Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation (°)"
 950        )
 951        fig_bond_angle.show()
 952
 953    @staticmethod
 954    def _render_sslist(pl, sslist, style, res=100, panelsize=WINSIZE):
 955        """Internal rendering engine that calculates and instantiates all bond
 956        cylinders and atomic sphere meshes.
 957
 958        :param pl: PyVista plotter object
 959        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
 960        :param style: Rendering style
 961        :param res: Resolution for rendering
 962        :param panelsize: Size of each panel
 963        :return: Updated plotter object
 964        """
 965        _ssList = sslist
 966        tot_ss = len(_ssList)
 967        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 968
 969        if tot_ss > 30:
 970            res = 60
 971        if tot_ss > 60:
 972            res = 30
 973        if tot_ss > 90:
 974            res = 12
 975
 976        total_plots = rows * cols
 977        for idx in range(min(tot_ss, total_plots)):
 978            r = idx // cols
 979            c = idx % cols
 980            pl.subplot(r, c)
 981
 982            ss = _ssList[idx]
 983            src = ss.pdb_id
 984            enrg = ss.energy
 985            title = f"{src} {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: E: {enrg:.2f}, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
 986            fontsize = calculate_fontsize(title, panelsize)
 987            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
 988            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
 989                ss,
 990                pl,
 991                style=style,
 992                res=res,
 993            )
 994
 995        return pl
 996
 997    @staticmethod
 998    def _render_ss(
 999        ss,
1000        pvplot: pv.Plotter,
1001        style="bs",
1002        plain=False,
1003        bondcolor=BOND_COLOR,
1004        bs_scale=BS_SCALE,
1005        spec=SPECULARITY,
1006        specpow=SPEC_POWER,
1007        translate=True,
1008        bond_radius=BOND_RADIUS,
1009        res=100,
1010    ):
1011        """
1012        Update the passed pyVista plotter() object with the mesh data for the
1013        input Disulfide Bond. Used internally.
1014
1015        :param pvplot: pyvista.Plotter object
1016        :type pvplot: pv.Plotter
1017
1018        :param style: Rendering style, by default 'bs'. One of 'bs', 'st', 'cpk'. Render as \
1019            CPK, ball-and-stick or stick. Bonds are colored by atom color, unless \
1020            'plain' is specified.
1021        :type style: str, optional
1022
1023        :param plain: Used internally, by default False
1024        :type plain: bool, optional
1025
1026        :param bondcolor: pyVista color name, optional bond color for simple bonds, by default BOND_COLOR
1027        :type bondcolor: str, optional
1028
1029        :param bs_scale: Scale factor (0-1) to reduce the atom sizes for ball and stick, by default BS_SCALE
1030        :type bs_scale: float, optional
1031
1032        :param spec: Specularity (0-1), where 1 is totally smooth and 0 is rough, by default SPECULARITY
1033        :type spec: float, optional
1034
1035        :param specpow: Exponent used for specularity calculations, by default SPEC_POWER
1036        :type specpow: int, optional
1037
1038        :param translate: Flag used internally to indicate if we should translate \
1039            the disulfide to its geometric center of mass, by default True.
1040        :type translate: bool, optional
1041
1042        :returns: Updated pv.Plotter object with atoms and bonds.
1043        :rtype: pv.Plotter
1044        """
1045
1046        def add_atoms(pvp, coords, atoms, radii, colors, spec, specpow):
1047            for i, atom in enumerate(atoms):
1048                rad = radii[atom]
1049                if style == "bs" and i > 11:
1050                    rad *= 0.75
1051                pvp.add_mesh(
1052                    pv.Sphere(center=coords[i], radius=rad),
1053                    color=colors[atom],
1054                    smooth_shading=True,
1055                    specular=spec,
1056                    specular_power=specpow,
1057                )
1058
1059        def draw_bonds(
1060            ss,
1061            pvp,
1062            coords,
1063            bond_radius=BOND_RADIUS,
1064            style="sb",
1065            bcolor=BOND_COLOR,
1066            all_atoms=True,
1067            res=100,
1068        ):
1069            """
1070            Generate the appropriate pyVista cylinder objects to represent
1071            a particular disulfide bond. This utilizes a connection table
1072            for the starting and ending atoms and a color table for the
1073            bond colors. Used internally.
1074
1075            :param pvp: input plotter object to be updated
1076            :param bradius: bond radius
1077            :param style: bond style. One of sb, plain, pd
1078            :param bcolor: pyvista color
1079            :param missing: True if atoms are missing, False othersie
1080            :param all_atoms: True if rendering O, False if only backbone rendered
1081
1082            :return pvp: Updated Plotter object.
1083
1084            """
1085            _bond_conn = np.array(
1086                [
1087                    [0, 1],  # n-ca
1088                    [1, 2],  # ca-c
1089                    [2, 3],  # c-o
1090                    [1, 4],  # ca-cb
1091                    [4, 5],  # cb-sg
1092                    [6, 7],  # n-ca
1093                    [7, 8],  # ca-c
1094                    [8, 9],  # c-o
1095                    [7, 10],  # ca-cb
1096                    [10, 11],  # cb-sg
1097                    [5, 11],  # sg -sg
1098                    [12, 0],  # cprev_prox-n
1099                    [2, 13],  # c-nnext_prox
1100                    [14, 6],  # cprev_dist-n_dist
1101                    [8, 15],  # c-nnext_dist
1102                ]
1103            )
1104
1105            # modeled disulfides only have backbone atoms since
1106            # phi and psi are undefined, which makes the carbonyl
1107            # oxygen (O) undefined as well. Their previous and next N
1108            # are also undefined.
1109
1110            missing = ss.missing_atoms
1111            bradius = bond_radius
1112
1113            _bond_conn_backbone = np.array(
1114                [
1115                    [0, 1],  # n-ca
1116                    [1, 2],  # ca-c
1117                    [1, 4],  # ca-cb
1118                    [4, 5],  # cb-sg
1119                    [6, 7],  # n-ca
1120                    [7, 8],  # ca-c
1121                    [7, 10],  # ca-cb
1122                    [10, 11],  # cb-sg
1123                    [5, 11],  # sg -sg
1124                ]
1125            )
1126
1127            # colors for the bonds. Index into ATOM_COLORS array
1128            _bond_split_colors = np.array(
1129                [
1130                    ("N", "C"),
1131                    ("C", "C"),
1132                    ("C", "O"),
1133                    ("C", "C"),
1134                    ("C", "SG"),
1135                    ("N", "C"),
1136                    ("C", "C"),
1137                    ("C", "O"),
1138                    ("C", "C"),
1139                    ("C", "SG"),
1140                    ("SG", "SG"),
1141                    # prev and next C-N bonds - color by atom Z
1142                    ("C", "N"),
1143                    ("C", "N"),
1144                    ("C", "N"),
1145                    ("C", "N"),
1146                ]
1147            )
1148
1149            _bond_split_colors_backbone = np.array(
1150                [
1151                    ("N", "C"),
1152                    ("C", "C"),
1153                    ("C", "C"),
1154                    ("C", "SG"),
1155                    ("N", "C"),
1156                    ("C", "C"),
1157                    ("C", "C"),
1158                    ("C", "SG"),
1159                    ("SG", "SG"),
1160                ]
1161            )
1162            # work through connectivity and colors
1163            orig_col = dest_col = bcolor
1164
1165            if all_atoms:
1166                bond_conn = _bond_conn
1167                bond_split_colors = _bond_split_colors
1168            else:
1169                bond_conn = _bond_conn_backbone
1170                bond_split_colors = _bond_split_colors_backbone
1171
1172            for i, bond in enumerate(bond_conn):
1173                if all_atoms:
1174                    if i > 10 and missing:  # skip missing atoms
1175                        continue
1176
1177                orig, dest = bond
1178                col = bond_split_colors[i]
1179
1180                # get the coords
1181                prox_pos = coords[orig]
1182                distal_pos = coords[dest]
1183
1184                # compute a direction vector
1185                direction = distal_pos - prox_pos
1186
1187                # compute vector length. divide by 2 since split bond
1188                height = math.dist(prox_pos, distal_pos) / 2.0
1189
1190                # the cylinder origins are actually in the
1191                # middle so we translate
1192
1193                origin = prox_pos + 0.5 * direction  # for a single plain bond
1194                origin1 = prox_pos + 0.25 * direction
1195                origin2 = prox_pos + 0.75 * direction
1196
1197                if style == "plain":
1198                    orig_col = dest_col = bcolor
1199
1200                # proximal-distal red/green coloring
1201                elif style == "pd":
1202                    if i <= 4 or i == 11 or i == 12:
1203                        orig_col = dest_col = "red"
1204                    else:
1205                        orig_col = dest_col = "green"
1206                    if i == 10:
1207                        orig_col = dest_col = "yellow"
1208                else:
1209                    orig_col = ATOM_COLORS[col[0]]
1210                    dest_col = ATOM_COLORS[col[1]]
1211
1212                if i >= 11:  # prev and next residue atoms for phi/psi calcs
1213                    bradius = bradius * 0.5  # make smaller to distinguish
1214
1215                cap1 = pv.Sphere(center=prox_pos, radius=bradius)
1216                cap2 = pv.Sphere(center=distal_pos, radius=bradius)
1217
1218                if style == "plain":
1219                    cyl = pv.Cylinder(
1220                        origin, direction, radius=bradius, height=height * 2.0
1221                    )
1222                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl, color=orig_col)
1223                else:
1224                    cyl1 = pv.Cylinder(
1225                        origin1,
1226                        direction,
1227                        radius=bradius,
1228                        height=height,
1229                        capping=False,
1230                        resolution=res,
1231                    )
1232                    cyl2 = pv.Cylinder(
1233                        origin2,
1234                        direction,
1235                        radius=bradius,
1236                        height=height,
1237                        capping=False,
1238                        resolution=res,
1239                    )
1240                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl1, color=orig_col)
1241                    pvp.add_mesh(cyl2, color=dest_col)
1242
1243                pvp.add_mesh(cap1, color=orig_col)
1244                pvp.add_mesh(cap2, color=dest_col)
1245
1246            return pvp  # end draw_bonds
1247
1248        model = ss.modelled
1249        coords = ss.internal_coords
1250        if translate:
1251            coords -= ss.cofmass
1252
1253        atoms = (
1254            "N",
1255            "C",
1256            "C",
1257            "O",
1258            "C",
1259            "SG",
1260            "N",
1261            "C",
1262            "C",
1263            "O",
1264            "C",
1265            "SG",
1266            "C",
1267            "N",
1268            "C",
1269            "N",
1270        )
1271        pvp = pvplot
1272        all_atoms = not model
1273
1274        if style == "cpk":
1275            add_atoms(pvp, coords, atoms, ATOM_RADII_CPK, ATOM_COLORS, spec, specpow)
1276        elif style == "cov":
1277            add_atoms(
1278                pvp, coords, atoms, ATOM_RADII_COVALENT, ATOM_COLORS, spec, specpow
1279            )
1280        elif style == "bs":
1281            add_atoms(
1282                pvp,
1283                coords,
1284                atoms,
1285                {atom: ATOM_RADII_CPK[atom] * bs_scale for atom in atoms},
1286                ATOM_COLORS,
1287                spec,
1288                specpow,
1289            )
1290            pvp = draw_bonds(
1291                ss,
1292                pvp,
1293                coords,
1294                style="bs",
1295                all_atoms=all_atoms,
1296                bond_radius=bond_radius,
1297            )
1298        elif style in ["sb", "pd", "plain"]:
1299            pvp = draw_bonds(
1300                ss,
1301                pvp,
1302                coords,
1303                style=style,
1304                all_atoms=all_atoms,
1305                bond_radius=bond_radius,
1306                bcolor=bondcolor if style == "plain" else None,
1307            )
1308
1309        return pvp
1310
1311    @staticmethod
1312    def display_ss(
1313        ss, single=True, style="sb", light="auto", shadows=False, winsize=WINSIZE
1314    ) -> None:
1315        """
1316        Display the Disulfide bond in the specific rendering style.
1317        :param ss: Disulfide object
1318        :param single: Display the bond in a single panel in the specific style.
1319        :param style:  Rendering style: One of:
1320            * 'sb' - split bonds
1321            * 'bs' - ball and stick
1322            * 'cpk' - CPK style
1323            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1324            * 'plain' - boring single color
1325        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
1326
1327        Example:
1328        >>> import proteusPy as pp
1329
1330        >>> PDB_SS = pp.Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)
1331        >>> ss = PDB_SS[0]
1332        >>> ss.display(style='cpk', light="auto")
1333        >>> ss.screenshot(style='bs', fname='proteus_logo_sb.png')
1334        """
1335
1336        src = ss.pdb_id
1337        enrg = ss.energy
1338
1339        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol. Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å Cβ: {ss.cb_distance:.2f} Å, Sg: {ss.sg_distance:.2f} Å Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
1340
1341        set_pyvista_theme(light)
1342        fontsize = 8
1343
1344        if single:
1345            _pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize)
1346            _pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1347            _pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1348
1349            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1350                ss,
1351                _pl,
1352                style=style,
1353            )
1354            _pl.reset_camera()
1355            if shadows:
1356                _pl.enable_shadows()
1357            _pl.show()
1358
1359        else:
1360            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(2, 2))
1361            pl.subplot(0, 0)
1362
1363            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1364            pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1365
1366            # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
1367
1368            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1369                ss,
1370                pl,
1371                style="cpk",
1372            )
1373
1374            pl.subplot(0, 1)
1375            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1376
1377            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1378                ss,
1379                pl,
1380                style="bs",
1381            )
1382
1383            pl.subplot(1, 0)
1384            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1385
1386            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1387                ss,
1388                pl,
1389                style="sb",
1390            )
1391
1392            pl.subplot(1, 1)
1393            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
1394
1395            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
1396                ss,
1397                pl,
1398                style="pd",
1399            )
1400
1401            pl.link_views()
1402            pl.reset_camera()
1403            if shadows:
1404                pl.enable_shadows()
1405            pl.show()
1406        return

1455    @staticmethod
1456    def spin(ss, style="sb", verbose=False, steps=360, theme="auto") -> None:
1457        """
1458        Spin the object by rotating it one revolution about the Y axis in the given style.
1459
1460        :param style: Rendering style, defaults to 'sb', one of:
1461            * 'sb' - split bonds
1462            * 'bs' - ball and stick
1463            * 'cpk' - CPK style
1464            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1465            * 'plain' - boring single color
1466
1467        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to False
1468        :param steps: Number of steps for one complete rotation, defaults to 360.
1469        """
1470
1471        src = ss.pdb_id
1472        enrg = ss.energy
1473
1474        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}"
1475
1476        set_pyvista_theme(theme)
1477
1478        if verbose:
1479            _logger.info("Spinning object: %d steps...", steps)
1480
1481        # Create a Plotter instance
1482        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
1483        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1484
1485        # Enable anti-aliasing for smoother rendering
1486        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1487
1488        # Generate an orbital path for spinning
1489        path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=steps)
1490
1491        # Render the object in the specified style
1492        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(ss, pl, style=style)
1493
1494        pl.reset_camera()
1495        pl.show(auto_close=False)
1496
1497        # Orbit the camera along the generated path
1498        pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=False, step=1 / steps)
1499
1500        if verbose:
1501            print("Spinning completed.")

@staticmethod
def enumerate_class_fromlist( tclass: proteusPy.DisulfideClassManager.DisulfideClassManager, sslist, base=8): 
62    @staticmethod
63    def enumerate_class_fromlist(tclass: DisulfideClassManager, sslist, base=8):
64        """Enumerate the classes from a list of class IDs.
65
66        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
67        :param sslist: List of class IDs to enumerate
68        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
69        :return: DataFrame with class IDs and counts
70        """
71        x = []
72        y = []
73
74        for cls in sslist:
75            if cls is not None:
76                _y = tclass.sslist_from_classid(cls, base=base)
77                # it's possible to have 0 SS in a class
78                if _y is not None:
79                    # only append if we have both.
80                    x.append(cls)
81                    y.append(len(_y))
82
83        sslist_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=["class_id", "count"])
84        sslist_df["class_id"] = x
85        sslist_df["count"] = y
86        return sslist_df

  • tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
  • sslist: List of class IDs to enumerate
  • base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)

@staticmethod
def plot_classes_vs_cutoff( tclass: proteusPy.DisulfideClassManager.DisulfideClassManager, cutoff: float, steps: int = 50, base=8, theme='auto', verbose=False) -> None: 
 88    @staticmethod
 89    def plot_classes_vs_cutoff(
 90        tclass: DisulfideClassManager,
 91        cutoff: float,
 92        steps: int = 50,
 93        base=8,
 94        theme="auto",
 95        verbose=False,
 96    ) -> None:
 97        """Plot the total percentage and number of members for each octant class against the cutoff value.
 98
 99        :param tclass: DisulfideClassManager instance
100        :param cutoff: Percent cutoff value for filtering the classes
101        :param steps: Number of steps to take in the cutoff
102        :param base: The base class to use, 6 or 8
103        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot ('auto', 'light', or 'dark')
104        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
105        :return: None
106        """
107        _cutoff = np.linspace(0, cutoff, steps)
108        tot_list = []
109        members_list = []
110        base_str = "Octant" if base == 8 else "Binary"

113

117            tot_list.append(tot)
118            members_list.append(class_df.shape[0])
119            if verbose:
120                print(
121                    f"Cutoff: {c:5.3} accounts for {tot:7.2f}% and is {class_df.shape[0]:5} members long."
122                )
123
124        fig = go.Figure()
125
126        # Add total percentage trace
127        fig.add_trace(
128            go.Scatter(
129                x=_cutoff,
130                y=tot_list,
131                mode="lines+markers",
132                name="Total percentage",
133                yaxis="y1",
134                line=dict(color="blue"),
135            )
136        )
137
138        # Add number of members trace
139        fig.add_trace(
140            go.Scatter(
141                x=_cutoff,
142                y=members_list,
143                mode="lines+markers",
144                name="Number of members",
145                yaxis="y2",
146                line=dict(color="red"),
147            )
148        )
149
150        # Update layout
151        fig.update_layout(
152            title={
153                "text": f"{base_str} Classes vs Cutoff, ({cutoff}%)",
154                "x": 0.5,
155                "yanchor": "top",
156                "xanchor": "center",
157            },
158            xaxis=dict(title="Cutoff"),
159            yaxis=dict(
160                title="Total percentage",
161                titlefont=dict(color="blue"),
162                tickfont=dict(color="blue"),
163            ),
164            yaxis2=dict(
165                title="Number of members",
166                titlefont=dict(color="red"),
167                tickfont=dict(color="red"),
168                overlaying="y",
169                side="right",
170                type="log",
171            ),
172            legend=dict(x=0.75, y=1.16),
173        )
174
175        fig.show()

@staticmethod
def plot_count_vs_class_df( df, title='title', theme='auto', save=False, savedir='.', base=8, verbose=False, log=True): 
215    @staticmethod
216    def plot_count_vs_class_df(
217        df,
218        title="title",
219        theme="auto",
220        save=False,
221        savedir=".",
222        base=8,
223        verbose=False,
224        log=True,
225    ):
226        """Plot a line graph of count vs class ID using Plotly for the given disulfide class.
227
228        :param df: DataFrame containing class data
229        :param title: Title for the plot
230        :param theme: Theme to use for the plot
231        :param save: Whether to save the plot
232        :param savedir: Directory to save the plot to
233        :param base: Base for class IDs (2 or 8)
234        :param verbose: Whether to display verbose output
235        :param log: Whether to use log scale for y-axis
236        """
237        set_plotly_theme(theme)
238
239        _title = f"Binary Class: {title}"
240        _labels = {}
241        _prefix = "None"
242        if base == 8:
243            _labels = {"class_id": "Octant Class ID", "count": "Count"}
244            _prefix = "Octant"
245        elif base == 2:
246            _labels = {"class_id": "Binary Class ID", "count": "Count"}

254            y="count",
255            title=f"{_title}",
256            labels=_labels,
257        )
258

@staticmethod
def plot_disulfides_vs_pdbid(ssdict, cutoff=1): 
463    @staticmethod
464    def plot_disulfides_vs_pdbid(ssdict, cutoff=1):
465        """Plot the number of disulfides versus PDB ID.
466
467        :param ssdict: Dictionary mapping PDB IDs to disulfide indices
468        :param cutoff: Minimum number of disulfides required for inclusion
469        :return: Tuple of (pdb_ids, num_disulfides)
470        """
471        pdbids = []
472        num_disulfides = []
473
474        for pdbid, disulfides in ssdict.items():
475            if len(disulfides) > cutoff:
476                pdbids.append(pdbid)
477                num_disulfides.append(len(disulfides))
478
479        # Create a DataFrame
480        df = pd.DataFrame({"PDB ID": pdbids, "Number of Disulfides": num_disulfides})
481        fig = px.bar(
482            df,
483            x="PDB ID",
484            y="Number of Disulfides",
485            title=f"Disulfides vs PDB ID with cutoff: {cutoff}, {len(pdbids)} PDB IDs",
486        )
487        fig.update_layout(
488            xaxis_title="PDB ID",
489            yaxis_title="Number of Disulfides",
490            xaxis_tickangle=-90,
491        )
492        fig.show()
493
494        return pdbids, num_disulfides

@staticmethod
def display_sslist(sslist, style='sb', light='auto', panelsize=512): 
522    @staticmethod
523    def display_sslist(sslist, style="sb", light="auto", panelsize=512):
524        """Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
525
526        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
527        :param style: Rendering style: One of:
528            - 'sb' - split bonds
529            - 'bs' - ball and stick
530            - 'cpk' - CPK style
531            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
532            - 'plain' - boring single color
533        :param light: If True, light background, if False, dark
534        :param panelsize: Size of each panel in pixels
535        """
536        ssbonds = sslist
537        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number of ssbonds
538        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
539        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
540
541        set_pyvista_theme(light)
542
543        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
544        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_sslist(
545            pl, sslist, style, panelsize=panelsize
546        )
547        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
548
549        pl.link_views()
550        pl.reset_camera()
551        pl.show()

Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.

Parameters
  • sslist: List of Disulfide objects
  • style: Rendering style: One of:
    • 'sb' - split bonds
    • 'bs' - ball and stick
    • 'cpk' - CPK style
    • 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
    • 'plain' - boring single color
  • light: If True, light background, if False, dark
  • panelsize: Size of each panel in pixels
@staticmethod
def display_overlay( sslist, screenshot=False, movie=False, verbose=False, fname='ss_overlay.png', light='auto', winsize=(1024, 1024)): 
553    @staticmethod
554    def display_overlay(
555        sslist,
556        screenshot=False,
557        movie=False,
558        verbose=False,
559        fname="ss_overlay.png",
560        light="auto",
561        winsize=WINSIZE,
562    ):
563        """Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
564        a common coordinate frame.
565
566        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
567        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot
568        :param movie: Save a movie
569        :param verbose: Verbosity
570        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot
571        :param light: Background color
572        :param winsize: Window size tuple (width, height)
573        """
574        pid = sslist.pdb_id
575        ssbonds = sslist
576        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)
577        avg_enrg = sslist.average_energy
578        avg_dist = sslist.average_distance
579        resolution = sslist.average_resolution
580
581        res = 64
582        if tot_ss > 30:
583            res = 48
584        if tot_ss > 60:
585            res = 16
586        if tot_ss > 90:
587            res = 8
588
589        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
590        fontsize = calculate_fontsize(title, winsize[0])
591
592        set_pyvista_theme(light)
593
594        if movie:
595            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=True)
596        else:
597            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, off_screen=False)
598
599        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=fontsize)
600        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
601        pl.add_axes()
602
603        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
604
605        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
606        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
607        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
608        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
609
610        if verbose:
611            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
612        else:
613            pbar = range(tot_ss)
614
615        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
616            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
617            DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(
618                ss,
619                pl,
620                style="plain",
621                bondcolor=color,
622                translate=False,
623                bond_radius=brad,
624                res=res,
625            )
626
627        pl.reset_camera()
628
629        if screenshot:
630            pl.show(auto_close=False)
631            try:
632                pl.screenshot(fname)
633                if verbose:
634                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
635            except RuntimeError as e:
636                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
637
638        elif movie:
639            if verbose:
640                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
641
642            pl.open_movie(fname)
643            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
644            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
645            pl.close()
646
647            if verbose:
648                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
649        else:
650            pl.show()

  • verbose: Verbosity

  • light: Background color

@staticmethod
def display_torsion_statistics( sslist, display=True, save=False, fname='ss_torsions.png', theme='auto'): 
652    @staticmethod
653    def display_torsion_statistics(
654        sslist,
655        display=True,
656        save=False,
657        fname="ss_torsions.png",
658        theme="auto",
659    ):
660        """Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
661
662        :param sslist: List of Disulfide objects
663        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook
664        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file
665        :param fname: The name of the image file to save
666        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot
667        """
668        if len(sslist) == 0:
669            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
670            return
671
672        set_plotly_theme(theme)
673        title = f"{sslist.pdb_id}: {len(sslist)} members"
674
675        tor_vals, dist_vals = sslist.calculate_torsion_statistics()
676
677        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
678        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]
679
680        dist_mean_vals = dist_vals.loc["mean"]
681        dist_std_vals = dist_vals.loc["std"]
682
683        fig = make_subplots(
684            rows=2, cols=2, vertical_spacing=0.125, column_widths=[1, 1]
685        )
686
687        fig.update_layout(
688            title={
689                "text": title,
690                "xanchor": "center",
691                "x": 0.5,
692                "yanchor": "top",
693            },
694            width=1024,
695            height=1024,
696        )
697
698        fig.add_trace(
699            go.Bar(
700                x=["X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5"],
701                y=tor_mean_vals[:5],
702                name="Torsion Angle (°) ",
703                error_y=dict(type="data", array=tor_std_vals, visible=True),
704            ),
705            row=1,
706            col=1,
707        )
708
709        fig.add_trace(
710            go.Bar(
711                x=["rho"],
712                y=[dist_mean_vals[4]],
713                name="ρ (°)",
714                error_y=dict(type="data", array=[dist_std_vals[4]], visible=True),
715            ),
716            row=1,
717            col=1,
718        )
719
720        fig.update_yaxes(
721            title_text="Dihedral Angle (°)", range=[-200, 200], row=1, col=1
722        )
723        fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, 320], row=2, col=2)
724
725        fig.add_trace(
726            go.Bar(
727                x=["Strain Energy (kcal/mol)"],
728                y=[dist_mean_vals[3]],
729                name="Energy (kcal/mol)",
730                error_y=dict(
731                    type="data",
732                    array=[dist_std_vals[3].tolist()],
733                    width=0.25,
734                    visible=True,
735                ),
736            ),
737            row=1,
738            col=2,
739        )
740        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=1, col=2)
741
742        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="kcal/mol", range=[0, 8], row=1, col=2)
743
744        fig.add_trace(
745            go.Bar(
746                x=["Cα Distance (Å)", "Cβ Distance (Å)", "Sγ Distance (Å)"],
747                y=[dist_mean_vals[0], dist_mean_vals[1], dist_mean_vals[2]],
748                name="Distances (Å)",
749                error_y=dict(
750                    type="data",
751                    array=[
752                        dist_std_vals[0].tolist(),
753                        dist_std_vals[1].tolist(),
754                        dist_std_vals[2].tolist(),
755                    ],
756                    width=0.25,
757                    visible=True,
758                ),
759            ),
760            row=2,
761            col=1,
762        )
763        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Distance (A)", range=[0, 8], row=2, col=1)
764        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=1)
765
766        fig.add_trace(
767            go.Bar(
768                x=["Torsion Length (Å)"],
769                y=[tor_mean_vals[5]],
770                name="Torsion Length (Å)",
771                error_y=dict(
772                    type="data", array=[tor_std_vals[5]], width=0.25, visible=True
773                ),
774            ),
775            row=2,
776            col=2,
777        )
778        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Torsion Length", range=[0, 350], row=2, col=2)
779        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=2)
780
781        fig.update_traces(
782            error_y_thickness=2,
783            error_y_color="gray",
784            texttemplate="%{y:.2f} ± %{error_y.array:.2f}",
785            textposition="outside",
786        )
787
788        if display:
789            fig.show()
790
791        if save:
792            fig.write_image(fname)

Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.

@staticmethod
def plot_distances( distances, distance_type='sg', cutoff=-1, comparison='less', theme='auto', log=True): 
794    @staticmethod
795    def plot_distances(
796        distances,
797        distance_type="sg",
798        cutoff=-1,
799        comparison="less",
800        theme="auto",
801        log=True,
802    ):
803        """Plot the distance values as a histogram.
804
805        :param distances: List of distance values
806        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca')
807        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for the x-axis title
808        :param comparison: If 'less', show distances less than cutoff
809        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
810        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
811        """
812        set_plotly_theme(theme)
813        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
814        flip = False if comparison == "less" else True
815
816        match distance_type:
817            case "sg":
818                column_name = "SG Distance"
819                title = "Sγ Distance Distribution"
820                if cutoff == -1.0:
821                    xtitle = "Sγ-Sγ Distances, (no cutoff)"
822                else:
823                    xtitle = (
824                        f"Sγ Distance < {cutoff} Å"
825                        if not flip
826                        else f"Sγ-Sγ Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
827                    )
828            case "ca":
829                column_name = "Ca Distance"
830                title = "Cα Distance Distribution"
831                if cutoff == -1.0:
832                    xtitle = "Cα-Cα Distances, (no cutoff)"
833                else:
834                    xtitle = (
835                        f"Cα Distance < {cutoff} Å"
836                        if not flip
837                        else f"Cα-Cα Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
838                    )
839            case _:
840                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
841
842        df = pd.DataFrame(distances, columns=[column_name])
843
844        fig = px.histogram(
845            df,
846            x=column_name,
847            nbins=NBINS,
848            title=title,
849        )
850        fig.update_layout(
851            title={"text": "Distance Distribution", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
852            xaxis_title=xtitle,
853            yaxis_title="Frequency",

@staticmethod
def plot_deviation_histograms(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, theme='auto', log=True) -> None: 
894    @staticmethod
895    def plot_deviation_histograms(df: pd.DataFrame, theme="auto", log=True) -> None:
896        """Plot histograms for Bondlength_Deviation and Angle_Deviation with normal distribution overlay.
897
898        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviation information
899        :param theme: The plotly theme to use
900        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis
901        """
902        set_plotly_theme(theme)
903        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
904
905        def create_histogram_with_normal(data, column_name, title, x_label):
906            fig = px.histogram(
907                data,
908                x=column_name,
909                nbins=NBINS,
910                title=title,
911            )
912
913            mean = np.mean(data[column_name])
914            std = np.std(data[column_name])
915            x = np.linspace(data[column_name].min(), data[column_name].max(), 100)
916            y = stats.norm.pdf(x, mean, std)
917
918            hist, _ = np.histogram(data[column_name], bins=NBINS)
919            scaling_factor = np.max(hist) / np.max(y)
920            y_scaled = y * scaling_factor
921
922            fig.add_trace(
923                go.Scatter(x=x, y=y_scaled, mode="lines", name="Normal Distribution")
924            )
925
926            fig.update_layout(
927                title={"text": title, "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
928                xaxis_title=x_label,
929                yaxis_title="Frequency",
930                yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
931            )
932
933            if log:
934                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.log10(np.max(hist))])
935            else:
936                fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, np.max(hist)])
937
938            return fig
939
940        fig_bond_length = create_histogram_with_normal(
941            df,
942            "Bondlength_Deviation",
943            "Bond Length Deviation",
944            "Bond Length Deviation (Å)",
945        )
946        fig_bond_length.show()
947
948        fig_bond_angle = create_histogram_with_normal(
949            df, "Angle_Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation", "Bond Angle Deviation (°)"
950        )
951        fig_bond_angle.show()

@staticmethod
def spin(ss, style='sb', verbose=False, steps=360, theme='auto') -> None: 
1455    @staticmethod
1456    def spin(ss, style="sb", verbose=False, steps=360, theme="auto") -> None:
1457        """
1458        Spin the object by rotating it one revolution about the Y axis in the given style.
1459
1460        :param style: Rendering style, defaults to 'sb', one of:
1461            * 'sb' - split bonds
1462            * 'bs' - ball and stick
1463            * 'cpk' - CPK style
1464            * 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
1465            * 'plain' - boring single color
1466
1467        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to False
1468        :param steps: Number of steps for one complete rotation, defaults to 360.
1469        """
1470
1471        src = ss.pdb_id
1472        enrg = ss.energy
1473
1474        title = f"{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}"
1475
1476        set_pyvista_theme(theme)
1477
1478        if verbose:
1479            _logger.info("Spinning object: %d steps...", steps)
1480
1481        # Create a Plotter instance
1482        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
1483        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
1484
1485        # Enable anti-aliasing for smoother rendering
1486        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
1487
1488        # Generate an orbital path for spinning
1489        path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=steps)
1490
1491        # Render the object in the specified style
1492        pl = DisulfideVisualization._render_ss(ss, pl, style=style)
1493
1494        pl.reset_camera()
1495        pl.show(auto_close=False)
1496
1497        # Orbit the camera along the generated path
1498        pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=False, step=1 / steps)
1499
1500        if verbose:
1501            print("Spinning completed.")
